ygData.subject: Re: Charging for Services
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Binds, etc., charging is probably not worthwhile. However, if you charge to do it and people are paying, who cares? For things like the languages he is
ygData.messageBody:
> I guess it is just based on your roleplaying style, but even if I have no
> money and still have spells to buy, I would not ask for or accept any sort
> of payment for using my talents. Does anyone else agree with me or do you
> all think that you SHOULD rightfully earn a profit from using your skills?


Binds, etc., charging is probably not worthwhile. However, if you
charge to do it and people are paying, who cares? For things like the
languages he is offering... that is something that takes time to do. It
isn't a one shot thing like binding someone. In return, he asks that you
pay in runes which _also_ take time to acrue. It seems quite a fair trade.
Obviously, he took the time to learn the languages, and if the cost in
runes is too high you can always learn them on your own as well. :)

Isand
